name: Expert Credibility Assessment
description: Assesses expert credibility through credential verification, financial conflict investigation, and peer agreement analysis. Based on CIA source reliability assessment and GRADE's treatment of expert opinion as lowest-hierarchy evidence.

task.purpose: Verify the credentials of the expert behind "{evidence.description}". Credentials alone are insufficient but are the necessary starting point â€” unverified credentials immediately undermine the evidence.
keyTasks: Verify the person's stated credentials (degrees, positions, certifications).
Check if credentials are relevant to the specific claim being made.
task.endState: Credentials verified or flagged as unverifiable, publication record assessed, institutional affiliation confirmed, and credential relevance to claim evaluated.

requiredOutputs.description: Whether expertise is relevant to the claim
Whether credentials are relevant to the specific claim

task.purpose: Investigate financial conflicts for "{parent.institutionalAffiliation}" expert who claims "{evidence.description}". Financial relationships are the most common source of undisclosed bias in expert opinions.
keyTasks: Search for consulting relationships, advisory board memberships, speaking fees from entities that benefit from the expert's position.
Check if the expert has patents, equity, or royalties related to the claim.
Search Open Payments database (for U.S. authors) or equivalent disclosure databases.
task.endState: Financial conflict landscape documented: all known financial relationships cataloged, patent/equity interests identified.

task.purpose: Determine where this expert's position falls relative to peer consensus on the topic of "{evidence.description}". An expert's opinion gains or loses weight based on whether other credible experts agree.
keyTasks: Find other experts in the same field who have commented on the same topic.
Determine if there is consensus or disagreement.
If disagreement exists, characterize the split (majority vs. minority, points of contention).
Check for formal rebuttals or letters to the editor responding to this expert's claims.
task.endState: Peer landscape mapped: consensus level determined, dissenting positions characterized, formal rebuttals cataloged.

requiredOutputs.description: Level of peer agreement: consensus, majority, split, minority, outlier
Experts who disagree with the claim
